title: ETZ Swap and AntiKYC io Partnership: What It Means for Private Crypto Swaps

friendlyUrls.anchor: ETZ Swap listed in a top no-KYC catalog
Wellcrypto partnership and safer swap route
Zano as a private L1 on ETZ Swap

keyQuestions: What is AntiKYC io and what does it do as a directory?
How does a directory help users avoid noisy search results and lookalike links?
What does the ETZ Swap and AntiKYC io partnership change for users?
Does no-KYC mean private or untraceable swaps?
What should I verify before swapping through any listed service?
How can I avoid fake support and pressure-to-pay scams?
quickSteps: Start from a trusted source and verify the service domain before entering addresses or copying deposit details.
Treat the network as part of the asset name and double-check networks before sending, especially for stablecoins.
Use a small test swap when trying a new route or setup to confirm the flow and expectations.
Track deposit and payout using TXIDs and confirmation counts on-chain rather than relying only on UI messages.
Stop if anyone pressures you or asks for secrets; never share seed phrases or private keys and never pay 'unlock' fees.

issueRouting.start: If something goes wrong, do not send additional funds. First collect the facts (asset, network, amount, TXIDs, time) and verify on-chain status.

branches.if: You are not sure you are on the correct service domain
then: Stop and verify the domain carefully before proceeding.
Use a trusted bookmark or navigate from a known ETZ Swap page.
Avoid links sent via DMs or pinned messages in random chats.
If uncertain, restart from an official ETZ Swap page and compare the domain.

branches.if: The swap is delayed or appears stuck
then: Locate your deposit TXID and verify confirmations in a block explorer.
Confirm you used the correct network for the deposit.
Wait for required confirmations during congestion.
If delays persist beyond normal, contact support with TXID and time details.
Review network fees, minimums, and rate movement during confirmations.
Confirm the sent amount above the minimum and on the correct network.
Use TXIDs to verify what amount arrived to the deposit address.
If something looks inconsistent, contact support with TXIDs and swap details.

branches.if: Someone contacts you claiming to be support or asks for extra payments
then: Assume it is a scam until proven otherwise.
Do not share seed phrases, private keys, or wallet backups.
Do not pay any 'unlock' or 'verification' fee.
Stop and re-verify the domain and your swap details before taking any action.

riskNotes: A directory is a map, not a guarantee; always verify the domain before swapping.
No-KYC usually means no identity documents during the flow, not private or untraceable transactions.
Lookalike links and fake support accounts are common; never trust unsolicited DMs.
Network mix-ups remain a leading cause of failed swaps, especially for multi-chain tokens.
Verification by TXID and confirmation counts is the most reliable way to track deposits and payouts.
Any pressure to act urgently or to pay extra 'unlock' fees is a strong scam signal.
